column2: 624 (2005 population) on the northwest Pacific coast of Nicaragua in the province of Chinandega. The municipality was founded in 1863.

column1: It was a railroad terminus and is Nicaragua's largest and only Pacific port for the import and export of goods. It has its Container terminal and is able to manage a wide variety of cargo: liquid
When Nicaragua refused to pay Britain an indemnity for the annexation of the Mosquito Reserve
column2: the British responded by occupying the Nicaraguan Pacific port of Corinto on 27 April 1895. Eventually the British left after being paid indemnities by the Nicaraguan government.

column3: U.S. Marines landed in Corinto to protect American interests during political unrest.

column2: President Theodore Roosevelt appointed the African-American writer James Weldon Johnson U.S. Consul to Corinto.
1922 the USS Galveston landed a detachment of U.S. Marines at Corinto
column3: to reinforce the Managua legation guard during a period of political tension.

column1: While supporting the Contra war against the Sandinista government in the 1980s
column2: U.S. Forces mined the Port of Corinto. On October 10
column4: an attack destroyed 3.2 million US gallons (12
column5: 000 m3) of fuel. It is believed that this attack was directed by the CIA and carried out by U.S. Navy Seals.
